Milt,
If there is very bad rust pitting, it's possible that you will be left with substantial holes after removing the rust.  This guard though is in good condition and it's very doubtful that there would have been extreme rust in only a few spots on the rim.

That said, tekkotsu are generally more rust resistant than the surrounding iron, so in the case of a very rusty guard the tekkotsu may become pronounced.  I don't know if that is what you've experienced.

Jim


  jim,
  I look very closely at pic #3..............
  I have seen this type very often in my " accumulation " of iron sukashi  
  tsuba. I always thought they are  what's left after one clean off the  rust.  

  milt
